intro: Physopyrum teretifolium, commonly known as the slender-leafed physopyrum, is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats, often along stream banks or in shaded understories. Its leaves are elongated and have a distinctive, narrow shape, while its flowers are small and clustered in racemes. The seeds are enclosed in slender, cylindrical pods that split open upon maturity to release the seeds.
